citing_paper_authors: Sam, Anzaroot | Alexandre, Passos | David, Belanger | Andrew, McCallum
raw_text: The overall modeling technique we employ is to add soft constraints to a simple model for which we have an existing efficient prediction algorithm. For this underlying model, we employ a chain structured conditional random field (CRF), since CRFs have been shown to perform better than other simple unconstrained models like hidden markov models for citation extraction (Peng and McCallum, 2004)
clean_text: For this underlying model, we employ a chain structured conditional random field (CRF), since CRFs have been shown to perform better than other simple unconstrained models like hidden markov models for citation extraction (Peng and McCallum, 2004).

raw_text: In recent years discriminative probabilistic model shave been successfully applied to a number of information extraction tasks in natural language processing (NLP), such as named entity recognition (NER) (McCallum and Li, 2003), noun phrase chunking (Sha and Pereira, 2003) and information extraction from research papers (Peng and McCallum, 2004)

citing_paper_authors: Andrew E., Smith | Trevor, Cohn | Miles, Osborne
raw_text: In recent years, conditional random fields (CRFs) (Lafferty et al, 2001) have shown success on a number of natural language processing (NLP) tasks, including shallow parsing (Sha and Pereira, 2003), named entity recognition (McCallum and Li, 2003) and information extraction from research papers (Peng and McCallum, 2004)
clean_text: In recent years, conditional random fields (CRFs) (Lafferty et al, 2001) have shown success on a number of natural language processing (NLP) tasks, including shallow parsing (Sha and Pereira, 2003), named entity recognition (McCallum and Li, 2003) and information extraction from research papers (Peng and McCallum, 2004).

raw_text: CORA (Peng and McCallum, 2004) consists of two collections: a set of research paper headers annotated for entities such as title, author, and institution; and a collection of references annotated with BibTeX fields such as journal, year, and publisher
clean_text: CORA (Peng and McCallum, 2004) consists of two collections: a set of research paper headers annotated for entities such as title, author, and institution; and a collection of references annotated with BibTeX fields such as journal, year, and publisher.

citing_paper_authors: Roy W., Tromble | Jason M., Eisner
raw_text: In bibliography entries (Peng and McCallum, 2004), a given field (author, title, etc.) should be filled by at most one substring of the input, and there are strong preferences on the co occurrence and order of certain fields
clean_text: In bibliography entries (Peng and McCallum, 2004), a given field (author, title, etc.) should be filled by at most one substring of the input, and there are strong preferences on the cooccurrence and order of certain fields.

citing_paper_authors: Donghui, Feng | Gully, Burns | Jingbo, Zhu | Eduard, Hovy
raw_text: Reported work includes improved model variants (e.g., Jiao et al, 2006) and applications such as web data extraction (Pinto et al, 2003), scientific citation extraction (Peng and McCallum, 2004), word alignment (Blunsom and Cohn, 2006), and discourse level chunking (Feng et al, 2007)

Examples of these models include maximum entropy Markov models (McCallum et al, 2000), Bayesianinformation extraction network (Peshkin and Pfeffer, 2003), and conditional random fields (Mc Callum, 2003) (Peng and McCallum, 2004)
clean_text: Examples of these models include maximum entropy Markov models (McCallum et al, 2000), Bayesian information extraction network (Peshkin and Pfeffer, 2003), and conditional random fields (Mc Callum, 2003) (Peng and McCallum, 2004).

raw_text: However, these works assume that property names are known in advance and focus on discovering values for these properties from very short product titles. clean_text: Although we are primarily concerned with unsupervised property discovery, it is worth mentioning (Peng and McCallum, 2004) and (Ghani et al, 2006) who approached the problem using supervised machine learning techniques and require labeled data.
